intro: [WRONG START] Ranunculus orephilus var. olympicus, commonly known as the Olympic buttercup, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Pacific Northwest. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, upright stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and meadows. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
